solution_04_inferential_statistics/05_exam4/02_one_prop_ci_pval_v3

By hand, this is easiest to do with a normal approximation without the continuity correction.

\[n = 119\] \[\hat{p} = 0.8067\] \[z^\star = 1.96 \] \[\text{CI}_\text{boundaries} = \hat{p} \pm z^\star\sqrt{\frac{\hat{p}(1-\hat{p})}{n}} \] \[\text{CI}_\text{boundaries} = (0.7357755,0.8776699)\] \[z = \frac{\hat{p}-p_0}{\sqrt{p_0(1-p_0)/n}} = 2.7531088\]

\[p\text{-value} = P\left(|Z|>2.7531088\right) = 0.0059032\]


  1. Normal approx: \(0.7357755\). Wilson: \(0.7266475\). Wilson with CC: \(0.7220292\). Exact Clopper-Pearson: \(0.7242396\).
  2. Normal approx: \(0.8776699\). Wilson: \(0.8676144\). Wilson with CC: \(0.8711248\). Exact Clopper-Pearson: \(0.8733561\).
  3. Normal approx: \(0.0059032\). Chi squared: \(0.0059032\). Chi squared with CC: \(0.0079543\). Exact: \(0.0053336\).
  4. The p-value is less than 0.05, so the difference is significant. /
